Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> When creating a pipe you can either set it to pure which only trigger reevaluate when one of the provided argument is changed, or impure which evaluates the value on almost every user action.

Some of my pipes are connected to a cache in an NGRX store, and I'd like to also evaluate the pipe's value when the cache updates.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Not sure how, but it would be nice if I had a way in the constructor to inject the store,  subscribe to the relevant event and call to reevaluate method.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Currently whenever the pipe is used, there is a logic in the hosting component's ts file that listens to the cache updates and increases a revisionId property. this property is passed to the pipe and trigger the transform (and that is the only purpose in life for the revisionId).

It work's OK, but there is some plumbing involve every time the pipe is used.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reevaluate pipe on demand" (#36294)

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): fix 2 bluebird test cases for each/mapSeries
Issues.Body:
`Bluebird.each` and `Bluebird.mapSeries` will accept a callback with `value` parameter,
the `value` should be the item in the array, not array itself.

For example:
```
const arr = [1, 2];
Bluebird.each(arr, function(value, idx) {
  console.log(`value: ${value}, idx: ${idx}`);
})
```

the output will be
```
value: 1, idx: 0
value: 2, idx: 1
```

This PR fix the test cases for `each` and `mapSeries` APIs.

Issues.Title: refactor(core): use more narrow `QueryList` import to avoid circular deps issue
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the `packages/core/src/render3/interfaces/query.ts` file used to import `QueryList` using `../../linker`, which contains a lot of re-exports and as a result, this one import caused a lot of circular deps cycles reported by the tool that checks such deps. In other places in the code the `QueryList` is imported using more narrow import (`linker/query_list`), so this commit uses the same pattern. This change allowed to reduce the number of known cycles from 343 to 207, the golden file was updated accordingly.

This issue was originally found [in a different PR](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/35568/files#diff-53230a72fded5e37a99eaf2b84393b06R12) while adding an import from the `interfaces/definition.ts`.

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): do not spawn more processes than intended in parallel mode
Issues.Body:
When running in parallel mode, ngcc spawns multiple worker processed to process the various entry-points. The number of max allowed processes is determined by the number of CPU cores available to the OS. There is also currently an [upper limit of 8][1]. The number of active workers is in turn inferred by the number of [task assignments][2].

In the past, counting the entries of `ClusterMaster#taskAssignments` was enough, because worker processes were spawned eagerly at the beginning and corresponding entries were created in `taskAssignments`. Since #35719 however, worker processes are spawned lazily on an as needed basis. Because there is some delay between [spawning a process][3] and [inserting it][4] into `taskAssignments`, there is a short period of time when `taskAssignment.size` does not actually represent the number of spawned processes. This can result in spawning more than `ClusterMaster#workerCount` processes.

An example of this can be seen in #36278, where the debug logs indicate 9 worker processes had been spawned (`All 9 workers are currently busy`) despite the hard limit of 8.

This commit fixes this by using `cluster.workers` to compute the number of spawned worker processes. `cluster.workers` is updated synchronously with `cluster.fork()` and thus reflects the number of spawned workers accurately at all times.

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/b8e9a30d3b6/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/main.ts#L429
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/b8e9a30d3b6/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/execution/cluster/master.ts#L108
[3]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/b8e9a30d3b6/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/execution/cluster/master.ts#L110
[4]: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/b8e9a30d3b6/packages/compiler-cli/ngcc/src/execution/cluster/master.ts#L199
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): do not spawn more processes than intended in parallel mode" (#36280)

Issues.Title: ngcc fails to scan directory in Azure DevOps Hosted Agent
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) `ngcc` ### Is this a regression? Unsure, we're using a different command than previously. ### Description After upgrading to Angular 9.1, the `ngcc` postinstall script no longer compiles projects in our `node_modules` folder. The release changelog for Angular 9.1 mentions changes to running the `ngcc` command. [Angular.io states ](https://angular.io/guide/ivy#ivy-and-universalapp-shell) the `postinstall` script should be "ngcc" (changing from `ngcc --properties es2015 browser module main --first-only --create-ivy-entry-points`). When this runs on local development machines (Windows, and WSL), the node_modules folder is scanned and Angular Material et. al are built in the various formats (`esm2015`, `esm5`, etc). Our CI system runs in Azure DevOps on Linux Hosted (ubuntu 18.04, x64) agents. When the postinstall script runs there, the command completes immediately with no targets compiled. The various libs and such are compiled when we run `ng [build|test] --project=[blah]` commands however. We cache our `node_modules` install so we can farm out the test, build steps for the multiple projects in our workspace in parallel more quickly. In 9.0, the cache would include the pre-compiled projects, but with 9.1 those are no longer in the cache, causing our CI build to take much longer. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 0) set up package.json with specified `postinstall` script, targeting Angular 9.1 & Material 9.2 1) npm ci ## üî• Exception or Error The build output will say it invokes `ngcc`, but nothing is compiled. We also tried running `ngcc` with `--async false` with the same results. We ran the command with `-l debug` and saw this output: 

Debug: Forking unlocker child-process
Debug: Attemping to write lock-file at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__ with PID 3261
Debug: Written lock-file at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__ with PID 3261
Debug: Running ngcc on SingleProcessExecutorSync.
Debug: Analyzing entry-points...
Debug: No manifest found for /home/vsts/work/1/s so walking the directories for entry-points.
Debug: Walking directories took 0s.
Debug: Analyzed 0 entry-points in 0s. (Total tasks: 0)
Debug: Processing tasks...
Debug: Processed tasks in 0s.
Debug: Attempting to remove lock-file at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__.
Debug: PIDs match (3261), so removing /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__.
Debug: Run ngcc in 0s.
Debug: Starting unlocker at process 3275 on behalf of process 3261
Debug: The lock-file path is /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__
Debug: Attempting to remove lock-file at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__.
Debug: The lock-file at /home/vsts/work/1/s/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/ngcc/__ngcc_lock_file__ was already removed.

Issues.Title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '…µcmp' of undefined
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? I don't know. I've tried with 9.0.7 and 9.1.0, but it works the same. I haven't tested earlier versions. ### Description We migrated application from 8.2.3 to 9.1. ng build and ng serve works as expected and application works with no errors. When we build with ng build --prod everything goes fine - no errors. But in production it throws this exception on loading of application: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '…µcmp' of undefined at Object.yA (vendor.a5630b07ff8c3731c011.js:1) at Object.mTkS (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1) at a (runtime.081b9fa9cdbc29e694e9.js:1) at Object.vkcX (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1) at a (runtime.081b9fa9cdbc29e694e9.js:1) at Object.j0Xk (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1) at a (runtime.081b9fa9cdbc29e694e9.js:1) at Object.vtpD (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1) at a (runtime.081b9fa9cdbc29e694e9.js:1) at Object.vY5A (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1) In vendor chunk. I explicitly set "vendorChunk": true, but even with false error is only reported in main. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I can't share code. I could only try to create some new project, but I would have to use every external library to try to find what is causing error. ## üî• Exception or Error

    at a (runtime.081b9fa9cdbc29e694e9.js:1)
    at Object.vY5A (main.b71bfbef186c603a7db8.js:1)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli - specifically `ngcc`


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.0 (or maybe 8.2)


### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> when ngcc runs on circle-ci it fails every time, but if I SSH into the container and run ngcc it completes successfully.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://github.com/paustint/test-ivy-app

Example failing builds:
https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/paustint/test-ivy-app/1/workflows/e3719bbe-f02c-40c0-8f6f-40c7e61f09ef/jobs/1

https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/paustint/test-ivy-app/1/workflows/e3719bbe-f02c-40c0-8f6f-40c7e61f09ef/jobs/2

**Note** This fails 100% of the time, but fails while compiling seemingly different packages (e.x. it is not consistently failing while compiling any specific package.

Issues.Title: Improve typing of common pipes
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: #36259
Several pipes have incomplete or incorrect typing.

## What is the new behavior?
The common pipes should now all have a stricter typing.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [X] Yes
- [x] No

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

It depends on what is considered a breaking change: some code that would compile will now trigger a compilation error. On the other hand, the code that is made invalid by this change, such as passing an object to a numeric pipe, was incorrect in the first place (it caused errors at runtime instead of at compile time).

Fixing the fallout should be trivial.

## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Improve typing of common pipes" (#36277)

Issues.Title: Local library "not a known element" error but still builds fine
Issues.Body:
I believe this is specifically caused by angular 9, very much a guess but the ivy compiler most likely?

When consuming a library generated and built the CLI, both externally via NPM link and in a project in the same workspace, an error is thrown by the editor and some times in the command line (not always) that any components from with the library are "not know elements". However the build will succeed and run perfectly fine.

I am running angular version 9.1. both for the library and the consuming app.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Local library "not a known element" error but still builds fine " (#36275)

Issues.Title: HttpClient is parsing a response to JSON ignoring the content-type
Issues.Body:
Using angular 8.2.14

Error: http.get<string>(url) fails to parse response data. 

Request headers: 
Accept: application/json, text/plain, */*

Response headers:
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8

Response data: S89


{error: SyntaxError: Unexpected token S in JSON at position 0
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)

WHY is JSON parsing done for response content type: text/plain?
This goes against all expectations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpClient is parsing a response to JSON ignoring the content-type" (#36274)

Issues.Title: Prevent anchorScrolling and support fragment in routerLinkActive
Issues.Body: # üöÄ feature request ### Relevant Package This feature request is for `@angular/router` ### Description Hello, In my project, we want to use `ancorScrolling`, it works very well. But, we also want to reflect the current fragment in the url to the user's scroll. We are able to detect the item currently displayed, but as soon as we try to update the url the `anchorScrolling` is triggered again. In addition, we would like to be able to use the `routerLinkActive` directive like this: ```typescript Test1 Test2 ``` But it doesn't work, all the links are active. ### Describe the solution you'd like In a first step, it would be possible to add a parameter in the `NavigationExtras` like `skipAnchorScrolling?: boolean` or `skipScrolling?: boolean`. To update the url without triggering the scroll. In addition, it would be nice if `routerLinkActive` supported fragments
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Prevent anchorScrolling and support fragment in routerLinkActive" (#36273)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/schematics-cli): replace deprecated runSchematic
Issues.Body:
## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)

## What is the current behavior?

The `angular-devkit/schematics-cli` blank schematic default spec file include a deprecated function `runSchematic` as stated in the docs :

```typescript
/**
     * @deprecated Since v8.0.0 - Use {@link SchematicTestRunner.runSchematicAsync} instead.
     * All schematics can potentially be async.
     * This synchronous variant will fail if the schematic, any of its rules, or any schematics
     * it calls are async.
     */
    runSchematic<SchematicSchemaT>(schematicName: string, opts?: SchematicSchemaT, tree?: Tree): UnitTestTree;
```

## What is the new behavior?

The function `runSchematic` is replaced by `runSchematicAsync` into the generated spec file and the callback of the test is now async : 

```typescript
const tree = await runner.runSchematicAsync('<%= dasherize(name) %>', {}, Tree.empty());
```

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/schematics-cli): replace deprecated runSchematic" (#17331)

Issues.Title: Css generated for Firefox ReadOnly to -moz-readonly does not work after upgrading angular 8 to 9
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, after upgrading from Angular 8 to 9, dedicated css for firefox about "ReadOnly" when associate with other rules is not well generated during ng serve. ### Description This issue appear only on Firefox. In Angular 8, a piece of style (from SCSS) code is automatically generated to ensure the compatibility with firefox about :read-only. Code is duplicated with :-moz-read-only . (with firefox prefixe equivalent) In Angular 9, this piece of style code is duplicated alone, in consequence, all the css block code is not duplicated, then, not interpreted. (I supposed first that was due to browserslist package, but package version is equal) To illustrate, this code : ``` .element1:focus, .element1:read-only { background-color: red; } ``` Is perfectly generated in angular cli 8: ``` .element1[_ngcontent-rga-c0]:-moz-read-only, .element1[_ngcontent-rga-c0]:focus { background-color:red } .element1[_ngcontent-rga-c0]:focus, .element1[_ngcontent-rga-c0]:read-only { background-color:red } ``` But wrongly generated in angular cli 9 ``` .element1[_ngcontent-wxy-c0]:-moz-read-only { background-color:red } .element1[_ngcontent-wxy-c0]:focus, .element1[_ngcontent-wxy-c0]:read-only { background-color:red } ``` In consequence, the other css style associate to the same css rule, :focus, is never interpreted on firefox due to :read-only which is unknown for this browser. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Here is a repository with angular 9, where the bug appear : https://github.com/albanlorillard/angular9-readonly-bug Here is a repository with angular 8, where the bug NOT appear : https://github.com/albanlorillard/angular8-readonly-bug In both case, use **ng serve --prod** and run with **Firefox** inspect in the style editor. ## üî• Exception or Error No exception. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

<!-- A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability... ‚úçÔ∏è-->

According to [Official Document](https://angular.io/guide/browser-support#polyfills), `polyfills` can only be included manually.

Sometimes we somehow use ESNext features like `Array.prototype.flatMap` but forget adding its polyfill into `polyfills.ts`, it accidentally breaks on some browsers.

### Describe the solution you'd like

<!-- If you have a solution in mind, please describe it. ‚úçÔ∏è-->

In @alauda, we are using [@alauda/custom-webpack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alauda/custom-webpack) which pipes `babel-loader` after `@ngtools/webpack` in webpack config, so that we get _auto polyfilling_ successfully via `@babel/preset-env`.

So I'm suggesting to add `auto polyfilling` support into `@angular/cli`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

<!-- Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds? ‚úçÔ∏è-->

If we can build all `.ts` via `@ngtools/webpack` with targeting `esnext`, then we can use `babel` to compiling all ES syntaxes totally but are able to get types metadata still at the same time.

---

Related: We can add `esnext` entry support for APF.

https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/issues/1542

Issues.Title: externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update') doesn't respect order in chain() for migration
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update (schematics) - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Only tested with ^0.900.0 ### Description For given snippet: 
export function migrate(): Rule {
  return chain([
    externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update', {
      packages: ['@nguniversal/express-engine'],
      from: '8.0.0',
      to: '9.0.0',
    }),
    removeImportsInMainServerFile(),
  ]);
}
Both functions are invoked almost immediately, as provided in the screenshot below. If I understand correctly, chain() method containing externalSchematics with @schematics/update should respect the order and finish migration and then invoke another function in order. Tried approach with translating tree to observable in the second function, however, the outcome is the same. Looks like @schematics/update performs this asynchronously, causing the next functions to be invoked immediately. **I haven't noticed this behavior for other migrations or schematics from Angular collections (like creating an app, component, service etc.).** ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create simple migration containing externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update') for any given library. ## üî• Exception or Error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10993491/77640869-60811200-6f5b-11ea-9917-9ee18e2bb813.png) The red highlighted area is separate function that should be invoked after @schematics/update for the library has been completed. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: bug(moment-adapter): "_rollupMoment__default is not defined"
Issues.Body:
(related with https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36248)

#### Reproduction

https://github.com/kaito3desuyo/angular-test

Steps to reproduce:
1. clone this repository
2. ``ng build --prod``
3. ``npm i -g http-server``
4. move root directory to ``dist/angular-test`` Folder
5. ``http-server``
6. open ``http://localhost:8080``

This issue only occurs with production builds.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Screen is displayed correctly


#### Actual Behavior

Screen goes blank with console error


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 x64 1909 18363.720

### Description
Update schematic should update TypeScript dependency too. Changelog for current Angular Core says that TypeScript was updated to version 3.8 but the schematic is not taking care of that.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14895873/77565535-205e5880-6ea3-11ea-9c4d-ba522740b1c3.png)


### Describe the solution you'd like
Angular core schematic should update Typescript for the required version, update `package.json` and notify in update log. I don't know if the same approach for RxJS update it's better or not, something like: `ng update typescript`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only workaround is to update via `npm` but that could lead to some issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Core update schematic should update Typescript" (#17305)

Issues.Title: bug([mat-table]): mat-tab-group messes up expandable rows in table
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz project: https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-itepdn
For some reason, the stackblitz preview doesn't show the bug, but you can spot it on development server and on the production-built sources. I've published the project on firebase, so you can see the behavior: https://angular-tabbed-table.firebaseapp.com/  
To see the bug, just open the app, switch to the second tab and go back to the first one.
  
#### Expected Behavior

Switching tabs in `mat-tab-group` shouldn't affect the expanded rows in the table.


#### Actual Behavior

All rows in the table are expanded after switching to second tab and back. This shouldn't be possible as normally the table allows only for one expanded row at a time.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows and Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([mat-table]): mat-tab-group messes up expandable rows in table" (#18939)

Issues.Title: fix(popover-edit): hover content not showing up if content changes after init
Issues.Body:
If the table's content changes after the first render, the popover edit wasn't showing up on hover, because some of the new subscribers weren't getting the previous value. These changes fix the issue by using `shareReplay` instead of `share`.

Fixes #18934.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(popover-edit): hover content not showing up if content changes after init" (#18937)

Issues.Title: refactor(datepicker): align preview range appearance with Material Design spec
Issues.Body:
Our current approach to styling the preview range in the same way as the selected range is discouraged by the Material Design spec and may make it hard in the future if we made it possible to have both a preview and selected range at the same time. These changes align with the spec by using a dashed outline instead.

![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/77820295-728cbd00-70e1-11ea-9df1-afef30b72a59.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(datepicker): align preview range appearance with Material Design spec" (#18936)

Issues.Title: feat(focus-monitor): refresh origin when aria-activedescendant changes
Issues.Body:
When a user arrives at a text input combobox (e.g. mat-input) by mouse but then uses arrow keys to
navigate the popup listbox of autocomplete suggestions (which causes an update to
aria-activedescendant on the focused input), we should just consider them as interacting via
keyboard for the purposes of origin determination. Currently, because no focus change takes place
during the input modality change, FocusMonitor doesn't detect it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(focus-monitor): refresh origin when aria-activedescendant changes" (#18935)

Issues.Title: bug([CdkPopoverEdit]): [cdkRowHoverContent not displayed when table dataSource changes]
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz to reproduce my issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-eo9e4r

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the StackBlitz link 
2. Hover over the "State" column
3. The cdkRowHoverContent will not be displayed on hover
4. Click on any cell of the state column
5. Cell gains focus and cdkRowHoverContent will be displayed for all cells (as expected)
6. Move to the next side with the paginator (dataSource updates)
7. The cdkRowHoverContent will not be displayed (has to gain focus by click again)

 ![ezgif com-video-to-gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37548459/77778125-d7e49d80-7050-11ea-8636-1ea12a120bf8.gif)
 
#### Expected Behavior

I am expecting that a change of the dataSource via the paginator or by initial loading of the data, will not require a focus of individual cells in order to display the cdkRowHoverContent. 

This StackBlitz shows the expected behavior, where hovering over any cell triggers the display of the cdkRowHoverContent without selecting any cell. In this example the dataSource does not change.

- https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-4xehdn


#### Actual Behavior

When altering the dataSource of a table in any way, for example by retrieving data through HTTP or paginating to another page with a paginator, the cdkRowHoverContent will not be displayed when directly hovering over table cells.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.1 (StackBlitz)
- CDK/Material: 9.1.0/9.1.0
- CDK-Experimental: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Google Chome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows (StackBlitz)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug([CdkPopoverEdit]): [cdkRowHoverContent not displayed when table dataSource changes]" (#18934)

Issues.Title: perf(material-experimental/mdc-chips): avoid checking the DOM on each change detection
Issues.Body: The MDC-based chip has a check called `_isBasicChip` which is called on each change detection, however its result won't change since it's based on the element's node name and a static attribute. These change resolve the value once and use a property instead.

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: feat: report warning if duplicate theme styles are generated
Issues.Body:
As of the new density API, a theme by default includes density styles
for the zero density-scale. This means that the common pattern of using
the `angular-material-theme` pattern for secondary themes in a project
causes duplicated styles for density.

We want to detect this case and report a warning. Most of the time,
for these secondary themes, only the color styles are desired. If this
is not the case and a special case surfaces here, the warning can be
ignored, but it's still helpful reporting that same styles are generated
multiple times.

We can update these instances in the future with a `ng update` migration.

Blocked on #18915.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: report warning if duplicate theme styles are generated" (#18927)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nlepch Steps to reproduce:
  1. Hover over a collapsed header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  2. Expand the first panel
  3. Click in the first name field
  4. Hover over the expanded header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  5. Tap tab twice to put keyboard focus on the 2nd panel header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
#### Expected Behavior Use the background color specified in CSS, for normal, hover, and focus states. #### Actual Behavior On hover over a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. On hover over an expanded header, the component is forcing its background to inherit from the panel itself. When keyboard focus is placed into a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. The only way to override this is seemingly to use **!important** or to override the generic mat-expansion-panel-header class. This appears to be a regression as it worked in some prior version of Angular Material (though I can't say exactly which). #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.7 - CDK/Material: 9.1.3 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System : Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS" (#18920)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Custom Component Themes): Custom components themes need updated
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I've been using Angular for over a year now and the page for custom component theming either needs removed or redone. It causes a lot more confusion that it has ever helped and the example is quite case specific and you simply can do a Google search to see there are absolutely _tons_ of confusion about this. Just look at [this](https://stackoverflow.com/a/58873540/3017217) answer on Stack Overflow, it's a prime example. It's not simple, not well documented, and Googling my problems usually are just leads to work around because of the lack of documentation. I'd like to help the documentation, but anyone hardly know how it works.


**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/guide/theming-your-components
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Custom Component Themes): Custom components themes need updated" (#18924)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag
Issues.Body:
Currently we resolve a drop list's scrollable parents inside `ngAfterViewInit`, but this might be too early if the element is being projected. These changes move the logic to the first time the user starts dragging which should guarantee that the DOM structure has settled.

Fixes #18737.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag" (#18918)

Issues.Title: help([google-maps/map-marker]): setOptions or setVisible...
Issues.Body:
Hello,

how call setOptions or setVisible for a marker ? (after init, display)

for exemple marker.title is callable but not marker.options or marker.setOptions:

(property) MapMarker.options: google.maps.MarkerOptions
This expression is not callable.
  Type 'MarkerOptions' has no call signatures

Sample code:

> <map-marker #markerElem
>                                                             [position]="gMap.marker.position"
>                                                             [options]="gMap.marker.options"
>                                                             (mapDragend)="mapMarkerDragEnd( markerElem)">

> mapMarkerDragEnd(marker: MapMarker) {
>         marker.title = "changed title"; // works
>         marker.setOptions({visible:false}); // doesn't works
>         // marker.options.visible = false ? // doesn't works
>         //marker.visible = false ? // doesn't works
>     }

Issues.Title: Changes for more convenient API to only generate color, density or typography styles
Issues.Body:
As discussed in the last meeting. We make the API for the theming bulk mixins such as `angular-material-color` more convenient, by allowing consumers to just pass a theme object.

Additionally, an initial draft for the documentation update has been included. Similarly, usages to the legacy theming color API have been replaced (also in the `ng-add` schematic)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Changes for more convenient API to only generate color, density or typography styles " (#18915)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): allow preview z-index to be changed
Issues.Body:
The CDK drag preview has a `z-index` that works with the CDK overlay, but might be too low for other libraries. These changes add an option that allows consumers to override it.

Fixes #18902.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): allow preview z-index to be changed" (#18914)
